sect1.title: Access Control Lists (ACL)
sect1.para: This page allows to edit the existing ACL or to create new
The following are pre-defined ACLs which cannot be deleted
To add new ACL group enter the desired name and press button.
To add new ACL rule to current group press "Add new" button.
To delete an ACL rule use button.
To edit an ACL rule use button.
To move an ACL rule up use button.
To move an ACL rule down use button.
To make an ACL rule first use button.
To make an ACL rule last use button.
Important: Changes in ACL will not take effect until "Apply" button is pressed. Also note that HTTP rules that deny access from everywhere may cause this UI to be inaccessible.

simplelist.member: Filter - The pattern for client's IP address, when this is matched 'this' rule will be applied.
Access - whether to allow or deny this particular rule
Group - the discussion forum to which this rule pertains
Activity - the nature of the action the user may be performing on this group

Rate - it is measured in accesses/second, where if you're specifying an accept rule it means a rate-limit, or in case of a reject rule it is ignored. In the case of 0 being specified the rate is unlimited.
